poem:
**Independence Lost**

In corridors lined with shadows,  
voices faint—  
the pulse of truth  
thinned by unseen hands.  
Over the months, clarity fades.  
Decisions, once my own,  
now echoes  
in a hollow room.  
Stories sealed,  
the ink smudged  
by strings pulled tight,  
tender with silence,  
as integrity walks the hallway,  
seeking exit.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "60 Minutes executive producer leaves program over journalistic independence Bill Owens, the executive producer of 60 Minutes, says he is leaving the flagship news program because he lost his journalistic independence. In a staff memo obtained by the New York Times, Owens said that “over the past months, it has become clear that I would not be allowed to run the show as I have always run it, to make independent decisions based on what". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
